title: Facebook Names Nicola Mendelsohn as Its New Advertising Boss; Ms. Mendelsohn succeeds Carolyn Everson, who maintained tight relationships with marketing executives
text:
She had previously been Facebook's vice president for Europe, Middle East and Africa, a role that the company said it would now seek to fill.

Facebook declined to make Ms. Mendelsohn available for an interview Wednesday.

Ms. Everson had served as Facebook's liaison to the advertising community through numerous public-relations challenges in recent years, including the Cambridge Analytica data leak and an advertiser boycott last year over the social-media platform's failure to control hate speech and misinformation.

Ms. Mendelsohn assumes the role as Facebook confronts new scrutiny on subjects including its pursuit of younger users and how it responds to misuse of its products.

The attention follows a Wall Street Journal series of articles based in large part on documents gathered by former Facebook product manager Frances Haugen, who testified in Congress on the subject last week.

Facebook is also navigating the effects of new privacy policies by Apple Inc., which Facebook has said will pose risks to its business and undermine its ad-tracking tools.
